title.value: Specific inhibition and disinhibition in the higher-order structure of a cortical connectome
title.justification: Title extracted from the top of the research paper.
title.quote: Specific inhibition and disinhibition in the higher-order structure of a cortical connectome

extractions.description: The paper discusses the structure of excitation and inhibition in the MICrONS 1mm3 dataset, an electron microscopic reconstruction of cortical tissue, identifying non-random motifs of seven or more neurons that facilitate a feed-forward flow of information. It delves into the specific and symmetrical nature of inhibition which contrasts the notion of non-specific blanket inhibition, emphasizing the discovery of higher order connectivity patterns and their implications for learning and plasticity in the neocortex.

type.justification: The study is based on the analysis of a biological connectome dataset and computational models.
type.quote: We analyzed the structure of excitation and inhibition in the MICrONS 1mm3 dataset, an electron microscopic reconstruction of a piece of cortical tissue.

name.justification: The primary focus is on the connectivity structures within neural networks based on cortical tissue data.
name.quote: We detected and analyzed directed simplices in the excitatory subnetwork.

name.justification: The paper addresses how synaptic plasticity reorganizes neocortical connectivity to implement learning.
name.quote: These findings have important implications for how synaptic plasticity reorganizes neocortical connectivity to implement learning...

name.justification: The paper extensively covers the role of inhibition within neural motifs and its competition mechanisms.
name.quote: Inhibitory interactions may also play an important role. For example, competition between assemblies may be mediated by inhibitory interneurons.

name.justification: The study uses algebraic topology to analyze high-order connectivity motifs in neural circuits.
name.quote: No aspect of the structure was evident when first-order connectivity between individual neuron pairs was considered; it required specific techniques from the field of algebraic topology...

name.justification: The nbS1 model is referenced as a morphologically detailed computational model of cortical tissue.
name.quote: Additionally, we compared results to a recently released morphologically detailed model with connectivity derived from the shapes of neurons and biological constraints (Reimann et al. (2022); Isbister et al., 2023).

is_contributed.justification: The nbS1 model was used for comparison and was not developed within this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Additionally, we compared results to a recently released morphologically detailed model with connectivity derived from the shapes of neurons and biological constraints (Reimann et al. (2022); Isbister et al., 2023).

is_executed.justification: The model was executed for comparison purposes.
is_executed.quote: The nbS1 model captures connectivity trends arising from the dendrite and axon shapes of neurons... It needs to be paired with inhibitory plasticity.

is_compared.justification: The nbS1 model is compared to the MICrONS dataset within the paper.
is_compared.quote: We compared the results we found in the MICrONS data to a recently released, biologically detailed model of cortical circuitry (Reimann et al., 2022; Isbister et al., 2023).

referenced_paper_title.value: Modeling and Simulation of Neocortical Micro- and Mesocircuitry. Part I: Anatomy
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced title for the nbS1 model is from a cited paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Additionally, we compared results to a recently released morphologically detailed model with connectivity derived from the shapes of neurons and biological constraints (Reimann et al. (2022); Isbister et al., 2023).

name.justification: The MICrONS dataset is the primary data source used in the study for analyzing neural connectivity.
name.quote: We analyzed the structure of excitation and inhibition in the MICrONS 1mm3 dataset, an electron microscopic reconstruction of a piece of cortical tissue.

referenced_paper_title.value: Functional connectomics spanning multiple areas of mouse visual cortex
referenced_paper_title.justification: This title is the referenced source for the MICrONS dataset in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: As a data source of ground truth connectivity at the scale required for an exhaustive analysis, we used a connectome extracted from a freely available electron microscopic (EM) reconstruction of neural tissue, the MICrONS 1mm3 mouse visual cortex dataset (The MICrONS Consortium et al., 2021)...

name.justification: The connalysis python package was used for the detection of simplices and related topological analyses.
name.quote: Topological analyses. Detection of simplices and analyses related to them were conducted using the connalysis python package.

referenced_paper_title.value: Efficient algorithms for weighted clique counting in weighted networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The connalysis package is used for computational analysis in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Topological analyses. Detection of simplices and analyses related to them were conducted using the connalysis python package (https://github.com/danielaegassan/connectome_analysis/).
